name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Honestly, this place was the best decision that me and my girlfriend made to come to such a beautiful place, especially for couples! And with such amazing staff with most of them being in recovery, which was the ultimate goal was to meet like myinded people, especially Staff that knew exactly what we went through and what we were going through and how to overcome this disease of addiction and alcoholism, one day at a time. The only thing I have to say in a negative aspect more like a constructive criticism aspect is that I just wish that the staff would have better communication and even with the low census of clients there, they would have the right amount of staff on Site to bring us to meetings and stuff like that and have more groups and stuff like that, other than all that, it was a truly amazing place, amazing people, amazing ownership, amazing recovery!!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I came in with no hope, no drive, and very little will to live. What I‚Äôm leaving with cannot be described with just words, but to say the least I am amazed at my recovery and the hope inside of me instilled by the principles and by the people at Ten Acre Ranch. I have already recommended this program to friends of mine still struggling in their addiction. And to anyone with doubts about this program, I had them too, but with the upmost amazement they all went away slowly but surely. A special thank you to V, Valerie, Esther, Dan, Claudia, Joe, Chef Mike, Ryan, Michelle, Katarina, Mike and Yvonne. Also want to say a special thank you to Banchi who is the kindest most genuine soul I have ever met. You all have made a profound difference in my life and have made the last 30 days nothing but comfortable and wonderful. The bonds and memories made here at Ten Acre Ranch will say with me for the rest of my life. Thank you, so much for changing my life for the better. And I hope others come along to find their sobriety and theirselves here as well.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Thank you guys so much for everything could not have done it without you guys I highly recommend this place for anyone who is struggling with addiction and want better for themselves thank yall so much that place is amazing shout out to Dan, Yvonne, Claudia, Valerie, Joe and esther thank every single one of you guys ‚ù§üíØüíØüí£üí•ü§ü‚úåüëç

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This will always be a memory I'll never forget . Struggling with addiction and understanding the mental health problems associated with my addiction has been my downfall for so long. 10 Acre Ranch was a perfect setting for me, my so called GF and dog to learn there is a better way of life. The Nurse on site was absolutely amazing and very informative. Her opinion was very much appreciated by the doctor helping him better understand my needs. All personal working there was again absolutely amazing. To me the food was a very important thing to my decision to stay or go! Let me tell you that it didn't matter what was on the menu , because no matter what Chef Mike makes you it's going to be a recipe in your new favorite recipe book! Quality hot fresh meals! 10 Acre Ranch saved my life üòÅ James Mcd

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place is amazing I have never felt so comfortable around complete strangers in my life they have gone completely out of their way to make sure I was taken care of the chef was amazing everything that man touched was incredible every experience from here was a blessing I genuinely love everyone that works here 10* staff for sure

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I would 100% recommend this place to anyone who is looking to make the first step to getting their life back from addiction to start right here! I honestly consider the staff here my new family I would like to thank Yvonne, Esther, Dan, Banshi Nurse Michelle, Viannie Chef Mike, Nanyo and Alejandra. You guys changed my life. I literally came here broken with two plastic bags because my baggage never made it off the plane. They were more than accommodating. These people truly love helping people it was refreshing to be around staff that love what they do.  I never felt overwhelmed, and I had a sense of freedom and time to address the problems that were actually effecting me. I wouldn't normally right a review this long but honestly I didn't even want to leave. This was one of the best decisions I have ever made thank you 10 Acre! ü§é

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This facility changed my life! I could not have made the changes in my life without their care, kindness, and guidance. From day one taking care of my physical and mental needs. They made every step easy and in my control.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
July 2023. I started a journey to stop using meth. That journey began at 10 Acre Ranch. I can report that, largely due to their program and, no less important, my implementation of the principles and tools they provided, I had a solid foundation and was clean from my drug of choice for just shy of 15 months. Then life happened. I was in a crisis situation caused by some underlying mental health conditions that were able to be clearly diagnosed because of my sobriety. Although I did not indulge in my drug of choice, I did end up in a situation that put my overall sobriety at risk. I needed stabilization and, if needed, a transfer to an appropriate facility. Even though that turned out to be [facility name], they took me in like family, helped me stay clean from my drug of choice, and helped me stay on this path of sobriety and self-discovery. In fact, when I had nowhere to go, no one to call, and the thoughts of giving up filled my head as my old survival skills tried to kick in, I texted (didn't even call!), and within 30 minutes I was in an Uber, on my way to a safe place.
Do you need that safe place? Are you feeling like you need a break from your personal crisis? Do you feel like you don't have anywhere to go but "dead"? Stop talking to me and talk to them. No one else is going to care and become a partner like this. After this short stay here, I now know it's not just lip service. Yvonne, Michael, and Ricky truly care about all their clients and want to see them succeed. They will help you define what success means and will, even a year later, be there to make sure you win. At least that is what my experience has been. Call them.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Great place and great staff I would highly recommend

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: 10 acre ranch is my 3rd rehab and my favorite. The staff, nursing and therapists are great, I always felt heard and respect. The groups are entertaining and helpful. I stayed for the 30 days and the time flew by! There are outings every week like the beach, baseball games.. we even went to sea world :). The housing is very comfortable, felt like home quickly. The best part is they allow your dog to go through the recovery process by your side. Would recommend üíØ

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I had a good experience they helped me a lot to get past my addiction I was treated really good and I would recommend anyone who is struggling with addiction to come here they'll get you past it

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Great staff and yoga and activities! Internal communication could use so.e work but overall a great place to rehab. Shout out to Nanyo, Todd, Dan, Nick, Ester, V, Banchi, Mike, Alejandra, Cat, Crystal, Ryan, Destiny, and anyone I missed, it was a great experience and I couldn't have done it with out yall!

review_text: 10 Acre Ranch is a great place. The staff is wonderful, kind, & caring. Fresh meals for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. I had continuous support from all staff members. If you come here you will really enjoy it & gain a lot as I have.

review_text: I love this place it, overall gave me a better out look on my recovery and the resources I need to further my recovery... I very much appreciate the staff for the complete support.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: came here unsure of things and now I can honestly say best decision I ever made for my life. Ty guys

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
A Spirit of Excellence.
With all sincerity and gratitude, the above statement is the heart and soul of 10 Acres Ranch Detox/Treatment facility. From day one to our last day the staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home, valued, and cherished. They treated us as real people, listened, and met our every need. All the staff understands addiction from a place of experience, and the atmosphere is one of no judgement. My husband and I came together and the treatment program is tailored for couples, we  received the therapy for ourself as well as for our marriage. I highly recommend 10 acres ranch! The presence of God is in the air, faith will be your shield, joy your strength, hope your helmet of salvation, and love will guard your heart! You will discover joy, and peace as you embark upon your journey of recovery!
Definitely worthy of 5 stars!
Come to 10 acre ranch today!

Best Regards,
Bethany and Jonathan G.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The 10 Acre Ranch staff has the ability to  connect with residents in a manner that healing will happen. The atmosphere is very welcoming and comfortable. From intake to the review, I felt like I really mattered and that is something people should look forward to when attending this facility.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place saved my wife and I lives. The staff have all been through addiction, so they knew what  we were going through and I can honestly say they cared about us. The second day I was here they could have sent me to jail and they didn‚Äôt. That‚Äôs when I knew how much they cared about me and my recovery. I could write about all the good things about this place for a couple hours but I‚Äôll just say that the food is #1 and this place is the most comfortable! From the staff on night shift to the case managers, program director, and therapist, this place is the best!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
My son attended 10-Acre for a period of time and had an extremely positive experience. The staff was very knowledgeable, knew how to connect to him (can't say enough about Ricky-you and Yvonne will forever be special people in our hearts) and continued to work with him to get a handle on his addiction.

They treated him like a human being, cared about his sober needs, held him accountable, fed him well (shout out to chef Mike), and are sincerely interested in his success after the stay at 10-Acre. They have even helped to create a very positive experience for his aftercare at a sober living house, all the while keeping his sobriety in mind while making a difference to him.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Working in this industry for over 20 years, 10 Acres has always been one of my top of the list for placement assistance for those in need of drug detox and alcohol treatment. I have confidence in the quality of care clients receive there. If you are or a loved one needs a drug rehab, go here

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Actually though this place helped me a lot. Chef is great and you are treated well here.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place changed my life! It was 30 days for the rest of my life! The staff was super rad! And really care about the people that are there to get well! We went on some bitchn outings that really teaches you to be out there sober ,Jamie my group meeting leader was super awesome and really gets to the point of what the problem is in each person,I would recommend this facility to anyone that really wants the help to get well

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
I came to 10 Acre Ranch broken and addicted to fentanyl and meth and whatever else was available. I had lost custody of my child and my personal relationships with my family and friends were suffering. I was totally incapable of living life on life‚Äôs terms and had trouble completing even the most minuscule tasks. I knew I was going to die if I didn‚Äôt change the way I was living and quick.
A friend had told me of a rehab center and boasted of his experience there. Having been to several treatment centers in the past I scoffed. I let my guard down long enough to think, what do I have to lose. The answer was nothing. I contacted the admission coordinator and the wheels were set in motion.
From dealing with all my baggage and the trouble it took me to even get there, to getting my wife and I a Uber, answering the 30 some odd phone calls to welcoming us at the gate. The staff at 10 acre ranch let us know that they cared and they were here to help us. The admission staff was amazing, the support staff was amazing, the nurses, Dr, Case manager, therapist, group facilitators.
(The Chef is amazing, special shout out to Chef Mike for always accommodating my wife‚Äôs dietary needs, she‚Äôs vegetarian.)
Everyone treated us so good that the time between my last use and the time it took me to detox was over before I knew it and I was well on my way towards sobriety and a new life. My relationship with my wife grew.  I made fast friends with other clients. I truly felt like people actually cared.
When our time came to move into the next chapter of our sobriety I felt empowered. I also was sad to walk out the gate because I had made a second family. Thank you 10 acre ranch. I would recommend your treatment center to anyone who is struggling with addiction. Keep doing what you do there.
This place is truly special. Do yourself a favor and get there. The rest is history.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Place really helped me out with my drug addiction. 10/10

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
Great staff members
Amazing food
Great groups Jamie is the best group facilitator I‚Äôve ever had!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
A Transformative Journey of Self-Discovery and Sobriety at Ten Acre Ranch

Review:
Upon my arrival at Ten Acre Ranch, my expectations were modest, yet the impact of the program far exceeded my imagination. This experience has reshaped my self-perception in profound ways. My decision to join this program, with the intention of breaking free from methamphetamine addiction and the cycle of relapses, has led me on an unexpected path of self-discovery and growth.

Central to this transformation are the remarkable individuals who guide us with unwavering dedication. Jamie, the adept group facilitator, and Joseph, who adeptly oversees the evening sessions, have been instrumental in my journey. During a recent session, I delved into the origins of my self-destructive tendencies rooted in childhood experiences. The program's unique philosophy underscores the fact that overcoming addiction goes beyond mere willpower; it involves acknowledging underlying issues and recognizing the triggers that fuel destructive behavior.

Unraveling the deep-seated causes of my destructive patterns, particularly when faced with success, would have been an insurmountable task without the invaluable support of the Ten Acre Ranch team. The facility offers exceptional amenities, including sumptuous meals curated by Mike, and comfortable living quarters that provide a solid four-star experience. Beyond serving as a mere group therapy setting, the program thrives as a therapeutic community. Although not all participants progress beyond the initial detox week, those who do find themselves embraced by an environment that nurtures growth, learning, and love in ways unparalleled in my experience.

This transformative journey has not only shifted my outlook on the trajectory of my life but has also underscored the significance of altering my surroundings‚Äîchanging the people, places, and things that trigger my self-destructive tendencies. The Ten Acre Ranch team has facilitated this transition seamlessly, from ensuring a smooth journey to the facility to aiding in the financial aspects of my ongoing recovery.

While the responsibility to implement coping strategies ultimately lies with each individual, the program's core mission is unmistakable: to guide us towards sobriety, eliminate toxins from our systems, untangle the reasons behind destructive choices, and foster a renewed sense of openness and growth. Bearing witness to the profound transformations in myself and my fellow participants, I wholeheartedly affirm the program's effectiveness. For those seeking a path that not only steers them through recovery but also illuminates a brighter future, Ten Acre Ranch is undoubtedly the beacon to follow.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place is amazing. Without the counselor Jamie this place would just be another rehab. But personally I have been to multiple rehabs and never got my problems solved or worked out. If you are looking for help and to work on yourself this place will do it. Jamie is amazing best guy in the world he will bring out exactly what you need to work on...

Thank you 10 Acres!!

review_text: I am so thankful I called to this place for my recovery, they made me feel welcomed from day 1, while every other place made me feel like a number. Between the staff, leadership and counselors, it was an amazing experience and definitely had a huge impact on me and everyone else. if you are unsure of asking for help or don't know where to go, call her first and it will change your life for the better!!

Yvonne for keeping her cool and calm with me, knowing what was best for me even though i didn't recognize it. thank you!!!!! In the end I wish I can name every single staff member because you were all key in my recovery! Thanks for all your support!!!!!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I can not thank the awesome staff at 10 Acre enough for helping my family in our time of crisis. My son attended the program for 30 days and is alive today thanks to the staffs patience, caring attitude and interaction to get him to a place of sanity once again. Every staff member I interacted with was always very caring, knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile to help. My son learned a great deal about himself, his addiction and the tools to continue his path onto the next step of sobriety. For the first time in years, he sounds happy and excited about waking up. A special thank you to Yvonne and Richard for helping keep this mama calm and to Ricky for extending a welcoming hand.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Shout out to Yvonne and Mike for helping young people like me with their mental health. Hope to see more people getting help in the future. Inspired me to help the youth personally. Good staff.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: After a long run of going from rehab to rehab somehow I managed to find 10 Acre Ranch. From the first phone call I made they have stuck by me. If I were to name the people that have been there for me I would be naming everyone. From the administrator to the Chef. Never once was I talked down to or made feel less than. I have never had people go out of their way to accomadate my needs like I have here. And last but not least they made a miracle happen. They were able to get my son to come as well. Once they found out he was on the streets doing Fentanyl they never stopped trying and reaching out to him. They have done so much for me and my son. I could not reccomend  enough. I hope you choose 10 Acre Ranch.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I would like to thank 10 acre ranch for helping me with my first  step of getting sober! It's a very good place staff is amazing! No  complaints from me! I LOVE YOU ALL THANK YOU üòä üíì!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place has helped me tremendously.  Being here I learned that in life I need to stay focused on continuous recovery and pursuing my goals in life.  I became reoriented on pursuing my goals and chasing after my dreams.  I had continuous support from my therapist and my case manager as well as other staff members here.  Overall this is a pretty decent treatment facility and the staff make it all the much better.  I got a lot out of being here, so come and enjoy yourself.  They do what they call outings every week whether it is a trip to a baseball game, the beach, or some other fun place such as k1 Racing and there was even rumors of going to Knotts Berry Farm which is a super fun amusement park near the area.  I think if you come here you will really enjoy it and gain a lot as I have.  Thank you and have an amazing day, all the luck to you.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: rickys morning meditation group was the best for me. he introduced me to my A.A. morning meditation that i will always use because A.A. works to help me  thank you 10acre ranch

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: 10 acre ranch has been a good place they got a good recovery plan and they help you out a lot

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I enjoyed being here very much. The staff went out of their way to accommodate me. Ester, Carina, Robert,all the Mike's, Blanca, Jeremiah, Ricky,the case workers, made me feel better when I needed it most in my recovery. I recommend 10 acre ranch.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
My experience at 10A Ranch for the very 1st time in my life I never thought I end up here but I'm so glad I found this place. I found out I have a case. manager a therapist and they were both amazing
Case manager - ‚ù§Alejandra- Help me she knows her job very very well.She impressed me. I will never forget what she did for me w/ paper work she Is amazing and impressive (Very)

never forget it

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The people genuinely care here. Thank you to all the staff at this facility. You really helped me change my life and I'm excited for this nrw journey

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Great place, safe, and reliable. First step to long term sobriety.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Best detox and residential program around! All the staff care very much about your recovery!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
Ten acres was an eye opener to my addition. Leaving today with 30 days of healthy boundaries . The staff was good an helped out when I needed it thanx for all the help, Esther was above an more to help when I was there also my case manager Ricky
Thank you all

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place was a fantastic experience they truly cared about my well being and didn't see me as jus a number I am grateful to have had come thru here and work on getting my life back on track

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: 10 acre ranch is a great place to get clean and sober! The facilities are nice and the entire staff is absolutely amazing and helpful with lots of experience in recovery. the food is great too.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I absolutely loved this place. The staff is the best. They are so caring above and behind.  The food is excellent. The place is clean and you get to go on fun outings the groups are good. Thank you everyone at 10 acre.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: They taught me how to have structure and to cope with my feelings and be a productive member of society!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: My experience at 10 acre ranch was nothing less than exceptional. The staff are professional and supportive and your treatment is tailored to your specific needs.The facility was cozy and secluded. If you need somewhere to start your life over and find a new perspective on things this is the place!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The staff was awesome- informative and attentive.  The faculty wasn‚Äôt what I expected but ended up being the best place for me.  My stay was what I needed and I would go back again- but hopefully won‚Äôt need to!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I came to 10 Acre Ranch after finishing a 90d. treatment elsewhere. I had plans to start outpatient treatment with the rehab I went to, but something was happening to their business. I moved to Riverside and was staying at a sober living with desperate need to find an outreach program. I was in an active dependency case and needed to do specific counseling and programs to prove myself to the courts to get my daughter back. I did not know the area and went to a local meeting with girls from my house. I shared my need for out patient services and need to test daily for the courts. I man came up to me in a NA meeting who was the director of 10 Acre Ranch Out Patient, we spoke about insurance and details of my situation. By Monday I started at 10 Acre with daily testing, classes and counseling groups. I am so grateful for 10 Acre for helping me do the footwork to be the mother I knew I could be and to show the courts "We do Recover". I have maintained my clean time and am grateful for the tools I learned at 10 Acre. Thank you for aiding me in earning my life back!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: i wanted a 90 day in patient treatment center and was prepared to pay out of pocket for anything my insurance didnt pay for .... but ciest la vie people assume the worst in people... addicts...

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: My expierence here was horrid. I did my detox and started my residential. During my residential time there was an incident with another client, in which they had to put us on lockdown and evacuate us because of the danger that was in play. The next day they told us that he was going to be allowed to stay and that if we had a problem with it we could find a bed somewhere else. They were choosing one client over 7 others who were actually working the program. If the other client was allowed to stay I was going to leave. The client finally decided to leave and he flooded the apartment, cut the phone lines, and the internet lines. I ended up staying because the client left. I felt as if I needed more time in the program and they told me that they only approved that for one client and that it wasn‚Äôt possible for me to stay longer than 30 days. Come to find out after I left they are letting 2 others continue the program. This place is unprofessional and out of control. The director has no idea what she is doing. The counselors were amazing. They‚Äôre the only ones who actually care about the clients. If I could give it a 0 I would.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: My husband and I were so relieved to find this program. They have been great about walking us through the help we needed to get our lives on track. I would recommend this program to anyone who is struggling with sobriety.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This was an amazing experience. All the counselor's were properly trained and meet all my needs. Group's were so educational and helpful toward my recovery.  I feel so grateful to all the staff as they were a part of my journey.  I will forever be thankful for 10 Ancre Ranch.  Very welcoming and homey feeling. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to make a new chapter in their life. Thank you all again for being a part of my  Journey.  Just for today I will take this second by second  minute by minute hour by hour. My life is worth it. I am worth everything. I am my own Power . My Sobriety come fisrt.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I am horrified with there professional behavior and follow through. All i can say is run, run, run.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I have a sister that‚Äôs been battling addiction for years and was referred to David L and 10 Acre Ranch by someone in the industry. As they say, this disease affects the entire family and we were attempting an intervention and felt so alone in the process. I called David and without hesitation he was so incredibly helpful and caring and, on a Sunday afternoon, was willing and able to mobilize and get my sister in to his center and we set a plan together. I felt like I had someone in my corner and the reinforcement we needed. He spoke with my sister on the phone and I was so elated that we could finally slay this beast of addiction. Unfortunately, my sister did not go that weekend and David sent follow up texts to her showing his willingness to help. We realize, we as a family, can‚Äôt want it more than she does, but we still hold out hope for her recovery. My review and five stars is for the incredible support David was willing to give. I will happily have my sister write a review once she completes treatment.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place is a Joke! For families that don‚Äôt know any better please buyer beware. All the photos that are shown in their advertisement are photos of their sober living home not the residential treatment center. My family thought they were sending me to a beautiful treatment center with horses in a pool in actual 10 acre ranch. The reality is it‚Äôs in the ghetto of Riverside it‚Äôs a group of abandoned duplexes that of been remodeled into a single bed rooms with window air-conditioning‚Äôs.  The facility itself is disgusting the dining room has no air conditioning in the summer when it‚Äôs 120¬∞. The food is disgusting and limited. Meaning that they cook one hot meal a day and you‚Äôre limited to how much you eat the food is locked up during the day and distributed at their will. When I got there I had forgot my toothbrush it took the staff three days to figure out how to get me to the Walmart which is down the street did buy a toothbrush and toothpaste. The groups are not run by certified counselors but 23-year-old interns that have zero respect for anybody. I‚Äôm not a better client that walked away and continue to use. I‚Äôm a grown man and I‚Äôve managed to stay clean and sober no thanks To my terrible experience at 10 acre ranch. If this place has done anything For me it reminded me of how much I never wanted to be in a situation where people like them had any control over my life, that has been enough for me to stop using. After my family spent $5000 for the week and the staff and treated me like such a dirt I decided it was time for me to go home. I could deal with the poor stuff with poor training, I can also deal with the terrible food and the terrible accommodations, but I cannot deal with the coeds having sex in the bums that walk up to the gate to sell dope and the staff that could care less when I told them. Please look into this place before you decide to send your family members there. There was only one staff member on the whole entire time I saw the doctor once, this place really needs to be looked over by whoever controls the regulatory system for treatment centers because of this if this Is the example of what‚Äôs out there I can understand why we have the problems we have with addiction today.I cannot stress enough the false advertisement that led me to this place. Again families do your homework and don‚Äôt judge this place off their website as he I cannot stress enough the false advertisement that led me to this place and don‚Äôt judge The level of treatment off their fake reviews You‚Äôll be fooled And upset just like I was.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Staff is Awesome.. Really care about your treatment an long term recovery. I recommend highly....

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I could not have picked a better place to embark on my journey in recovery. All of my physical, mental and spiritual needs have been met at this location. The facilities are top notch and include all the amenities one could ask for at the treatment and sober living locations. The staff is always attentive, respectful and diligent in not only providing timely guidance and care but it is also done with genuine love and affection. I wholeheartedly recommend this place if you are serious about recovering from addiction and being giving the tools to live a productive and meaningful life.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: 9 yrs sober. Took 11 rehabs. This was the worst place of the 11. Didn't even detox me before admittance.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
this has been one of the best experiences i have had in treatment.  I have been struggling with alcohol for many years and tried to beat it many times on my own and was never able to. Since i came to 10 acre ranch i finally feel free. The staff loved me until i could love myself again, it was definetly a struggle but nobody gave up on me. The staff cared about ME and supported and encouraged me to push through everyday.  Ive learned so much about myself and can honestly say, I am sober today, i love who i am, and now for the first time since i was a teenager i  look in the mirror and smile at what i see.
Thank you 10 acre ranch for the love, hope, and the chance to make my dreams come true.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: They are great awesome service and staff,unbelievable . thanks to all of them .

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: keep to the right

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The staff here is very helpful for both the patient and the family.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: My sister in law found the 10 acre ranch made all the calls for myself her brother and her nephew.they then got back in touch with us and giving us all the info we needed..so we set up a intervention for our family..David  then came  to our home..we did intervention..but our son wasn't ready to leave he left 3 days after that on his own..the ranch was costly but well worth it..my son needed this big expense to get off everything he was on included a controlled methadone program..they did great my son was never sick through all this .he really liked the detox plus the program..the staff were great..we give our hats of to the 10 acre ranch..if you need help truly call them..they will give u all u need up front and honest. Thank u to david and the staff..from the hibbards

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Had several members of their staff present at our school for health week. They are incredible individuals with so much to give. Thanks David!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The staff really cares about you, they are very compassionate about what they do. They will make you feel comfortable and at home. My experience was positive, I would not be where I am today without the love and support of 10 Acre Ranch. Thank you everyone for being the BEST part of my journey!!!!

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
On August 5, 2018 I woke up sick and tired, defeated and alone.
I had an empty handle and 3 empty pints of vodka setting on the night stand. I know I bought the handle of vodka after work the day before (less than 18 hours) I had no memory of driving 3 different times to buy the pint bottles of vodka (I drove in a complete blackout) I crawled around on the floor checking to see if I spilled it. None was spilt, I‚Äôd drank over 2 liters of Vodka in under 18 hours. I stumbled outside to check my car to see if there was any damage. No damage. After that I got on the phone and started calling to get help. I called several recovery centers. One place didn‚Äôt take my insurance, another said they‚Äôd have someone call me back. Scrolling through google I called 10 Acre Ranch David Levington answered and listen to my pleas for help. Less than an hour there was a knock on the door, it was a staff member from 10 Acre Ranch. He told me to get my dog and asked if I had everything. ‚ÄúYa!‚Äù
I didn‚Äôt pack anything, just grabbed Sabbath and never looked back.
Thank you to David L. , his family and his staff of 10 Acre Ranch.
Thank you to my family and friends for everything during this journey and more importantly thank you for not holding on to your anger and frustrations with me during that dark time.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Great place to learn what it takes to stay sober one day at a time. The genunuity of staff was key in helping me make the most significant change of my life after suffering for fifteen years from a serious opiod addiction that nearly took my life. You'll meet people that will be true friends for life.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The staff there went above and beyond there duetes to help me through the program. At first I couldent make it through a meeting without haveing panick attacks. Being a duel diagnosis. They were patient with me and there for me even after they where clocked out. I'm have been told I'm night and day from when I arrived there and it's all thanks to the program and the people there. Thanks Ten acers.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The ranch is a fine place to start your recovery you can get good tools and most of the staff are a lot of help and the peers you will make and meet will become some of your best friends and a new family I have 315 days clean and sober thanks to this family if and when you are ready we are here and we want to help you succeed.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I‚Äôm so glad I made that call to 10 acre ranch. They were so understanding and welcoming. They showed me how to live on life‚Äôs terms.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The 10 Acres Ranch has given me the life ever it's everyone adopted me because I bring light to people's day when begin this journey I was torn but certain members who I say family and friends Remita, Mike, Jimmy, Jenessa Alan Jeff Luis Wendy thank you I love you

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: This place is amazing. Everyone here is serious and heartwarming about recovery. If I ever needed anything everyone had my back. I didnt just get clean here I learned how to live

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Amazing place and people

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: 10 Acre Ranch gave me the skills to succeed long after I left their treatment program. They gave me the confidence I needed to take care of myself.  I would highly recommend this provider to anyone looking to live a life free from drugs and alcohol.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: They had an excellent record and state certification, send your loved ones this way.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I went to 10 Acre Ranch at the age of 50 after realizing I could no longer fight my addiction alone. I was concerned that my age would make worse what I already thought of as a situation too difficult for me to handle. I was angry at everyone and everything but upon arriving I was treated with love and respect by the staff. I was put at ease by being immediately made to feel a welcome part of the group. I quickly learned that this social treatment model was ideal for my situation because everyone was so strongly encouraged to form an immediate bond with one another regardless of our individual backgrounds. We were all encouraged to work on our own recovery as much together as we were individually and were given (or rather taught) the tools to complete the program successfully. Just like the 12 step programs we were exposed to, the encouragement and opportunity to succeed is there provided residents are willing to work for it. It was obvious to me that when the staff saw that I was dedicated to my own recovery they made sure I had access to every resource at their disposal...and their best resources are their people. Each of the staff brings their own specialty expertise to "The Ranch" and does their utmost to share it with their residents. I traveled from NJ to CA to go to 10 Acre Ranch because it was economically attractive and even back on the other side of the country I can say I made a host of lifelong friends during my stay there.  As I write this I am over two years clean and sober as a direct result of my experiences there. I encourage men from any background to strongly consider this facility because the program works. Review their website and trust that everything you see there is a huge part of their treatment model. It's all there at your disposal topped off by a successful start toward lifelong recovery. I owe my life to 10 Acre Ranch.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Amazing place with amazing staff! Everyone at 10 Acre Ranch gave me hope during a seemingly hopeless time. I will always have a special place in my heart for 10 Acre Ranch.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The 10 CRE Ranch was the best decision I ever made, The night I walked in I was greated with love and understanding how I was feeling, I was a little apprehensive at first but after meeting with some of the staff and other residents I started to feel the peace that was going on around me and I liked what I feeling.My life has turned around 180 percent and I have no one but God and the amazing staff member's for my new life. This change took place 20 years ago and it's still changing. Thanks 10 Acre Ranch.üòéüòÇ

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: The ranch truly saved my life. I was facing homelessness and hopelessness when I got to the ranch they helped me find a new way of life. It has been 7 years since I went to the ranch and I'm still clean and sober today

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Over the years the Ranch has produced a high quality of recovering alcoholics and addicts. The spirit of love, tolerance and altruism is infectious.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: On July 9th, 2012, I was begged by my family to get some help.  45 minutes later I was admitted into the 10 Acre Ranch.  Scared, ashamed and in reality,  at deaths door.  From the first person I met in the driveway, who took my backpack,  smiled and said "welcome home", I felt a sense of relief.  The staff gave me hope, gave me a sense of belonging, that I wasn't alone in this thing.  I now have the tools to live life, on life's terms. I thank you and my family thanks you.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: this place saved my life...i dont know of anyway to express the gratitude i have for the staff here..everyone here treated me like family and were genuinely concerned with my recovery. thanks to them my life has turned around 100% from a path of self-destruction to one of hope and blessings

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Amazing staff, great environment.  Excellent after care relationship... Kept me sober and supported for over two years...

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: Five years. That's how many years of peace and happiness I have and I owe so much of that to the solid foundation that the 10acre Ranch gave to me. It also gave me a healthy path to follow, a circle of men who became my brothers and a deep sense of gratitude that fills me each day.  I am forever grateful to this amazing place.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text:
I really owe my life to this place to. I came in on a skateboard just feeling hopeless. My journey at the ranch was a roller coaster of feelings and emotions. I was still doing what I was doing out there in the ranch and they just lived up on me till I can love myself. They told me only one thing that needs to change and that was everything. Once I made that decision to give myself to the program my life had changed tremendously. I'm a son to my parents a brother to my siblings also a productive member of society. My clean date is 5-11-12 and still to this day continue going to ranch to share what was givin to me in hopes that they stay clean one day at a time.

-Chris R

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: tried many other centers but this center focused on real recovery and rebuilding lives. I was so grateful to finally get to a treatment center where the direct truth was told to me while the support to rebuild my life by men was also in place. what a great experience and my life today is what I always intended it to be. My words today and my actions are totally aligned and I have rebuilt my life and all my relationships. Thank you 10 acre ranch and staff.

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I went in 2007 still sober till this day .I want to thank Bart and Harry for everything  they did

name: 10 Acre Ranch
review_text: I also rehabbed in the 1990s. Bart was good. So we're some other staff member.  They even had a pig and pig roast.   Good luck
